description:
Results-driven senior leader with a proven record of accomplishments leading information security initiatives in collaboration with key government cybersecurity partners to advance the security posture of organizations. Experienced building security programs that include development of plans and programs, identification of threats, analysis of risks, development of risk management plans, testing the effectiveness of security controls, reporting to senior management and oversight organizations on the status of information security. Organized, take-charge professional with exceptional follow-through abilities and detail orientation; able to plan and oversee programs from conception to successful operation.

Broad, deep strategic knowledge with a rare and diverse background that spans both Commercial and Federal sectors of information security.  Recognized for leadership and was elected to the Board of Directors for the International Information Systems Security Certification Consortium, Inc., (ISC)¬≤, which is a global, not-for-profit leader in educating and certifying information security professionals throughout their careers. In addition, I was selected as a member of the White House Security Metrics Task Force which defined new Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA) performance and outcome-based metrics. These information security performance metrics highlighted risk areas needing improvement for Federal agencies and represented a significant shift from prior FISMA reporting.

description:
Dr. Chronis-Tuscano' research focuses broadly on understanding early predictors of developmental outcomes for children with Attention- Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) and developing novel treatments which target these early risk and protective factors. Much of this research has addressed issues related to maternal parenting and psychopathology (namely, maternal depression and ADHD). 

A secondary line of research, conducted in collaboration with faculty in Human Development, aims to examine the trajectory of young children displaying early behavioral inhibition, including the development of psychopathology, and to intervene by targeting key moderators of outcome (e.g., parenting and social relationships). 

Recent projects conducted by Dr. Chronis-Tuscano‚Äôs research group include: (1) the development and evaluation of an integrated parenting program for depressed mothers of children with ADHD; (2) examination of early predictors of developmental outcomes in a large sample of preschool-aged children with and without ADHD; and (3) development and evaluation of a parent-child intervention for families of inhibited preschool-aged children.

Dr. Chronis-Tuscano is the Associate Editor of the Journal of Clinical Child & Adolescent Psychology; on the APA Division 12 Presidential Task Force on Enhancing Graduate Training in Evidence-Based Practice in Psychology; and serves the Scientific Advisor to the NIMH Outreach Partnership with the State of Maryland. She is the recipient of multiple NIH grants and has served on the NIMH Interventions Committee for Children and their Families.

description: An experienced North Carolina State Probation-Parole Officer who has worked in two of its largest counties and a Master's degree in Forensic Psychology to find another way to have an effective impact on those that have been affected by the criminal justice system. I have supervised 2 special population/high risk caseloads, mentored new officers, taught automation and investigation classes,  and made strides to strengthen working relationships with local entities. My psychological studies paired with  pharmaceutical experience gives me a different standpoint than the average law enforcement officer and that is what makes me shine.
headline: Masters of Science in Forensic Psychology
company: U. S. Courts Probation and Pretrial Services
company2: North Carolina Department of Public Safety
jobDescription2:
Manage a caseload of adult offenders by employing motivational interviewing skills to complete an assessment of criminogenic risks and needs to determine an appropriate level of supervision and intervention. Offenders are given referrals and resources to programs that will make them successful through and after supervision. Establish and maintain effective professional relationships with local law enforcement, court personnel, and all other stakeholders. Prepare and present detailed information to court staff and/or Hearing Officers when necessary. Handle confidential information with utmost integrity and professionalism. Train and mentor new employees from various backgrounds with an emphasis on cultural sensitivity, diversity, and various learning styles. Utilize a plethora of web/data bases for investigative information such as OPUS, CJ LEADS, NC AWARE.

I was afforded an opportunity to supervise a high risk caseload of validated gang members in September 2018 and with that came the responsibility of imposing Security Risk Group sanctions, creating operations plans for searches, and working more closely with the Greensboro Police Department and the Task Force. This caseload refined my investigative skills as well as effective communication efforts with those that were assigned to me and all other parties I came in contact with. I was allowed to take part in policymaking with the Special Operations Intelligence Unit for potential statewide training.

I currently hold another specialty caseload of Sex Offenders which has allowed me to be challenged on another level and gain more knowledge of this special population. This caseload has expanded my network, communicative skills, and abilities as a State Probation Parole Officer.

headline: Psychology Student at University of Maryland
jobDescription: As Research Assistant in the BEAD (Big Emotions Across Development) Lab, I investigate youth irritability covering the transition to adolescence and its neural correlates utilizing open data from the Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development (ABCD) Study. The ABCD Study is a longitudinal study that includes more than 11,000 preadolescent children (aged 9-10) from 21 research sites across the United States. The ABCD Study investigates brain development and health of adolescents annually for 10 years. Using the results from the ABCD Study, the research lab as a whole hopes to better comprehend how neural processes regarding reward processing and inhibitory control contribute to youth irritability.

description:
My passion for English was ignited by my sociology students. In school many students come into the academic process of higher learning unable to read and write at the college level. So, while sociology is a research-based discipline it is my job as an educator to produce better writers. It has been essential for me to find unique and creative ways to bridge the gap between the discipline of psychology, sociology, and English. It takes a unique skill to make these genres coexist within the confines of the classroom. What I think is extremely unique is my ability to take the textbook and make it come to life where the words leap off the page and into the hearts and minds of young learners no matter what level they enter my classroom. 

I feel strongly that psychology and sociology need one another to coexist or at least to explain why it is that our students come to us with some awareness of the environment around them. It is my job to help them see not only the world around them from a different context, but to also see themselves. Take sociology and psychology for example, in the sense that everything that we go through in our day-to-day existence impacts our lives on some micro or macro socio-economical level. One does not simply face various healthcare and economic disparities because of their gender, race, class, or religion. But rather it is a culmination of these factors. For example, intersectionality deems that if one is female, Hispanic, working poor, and Catholic; the outcome of the disparities and institutional markers she faces are her lived experience-not experienced separately but simultaneously. Thus, you take that same woman, after looking at how these social factors can impact her daily and I often ask myself what bearing do these indicators have on her emotional and psychological wellbeing? Consequently, making these two disciplines coexist. There is a direct correlation between the social aspects of human life and how they experience the world around them based on their race, class, gender, etc. as well as the psychological implications or the power one‚Äôs social world has on their emotions, personality, and psyche. Therefore, sociology and psychology should be looked at in a contextual framework of coexistence.

description:
I am an energized Appalachian woman. Currently, I am a Master of Arts student in Experimental Psychology, at the University of North Carolina at Greensboro. I completed my Bachelor's of Science at Virginia Tech in Psychology with minors in Disabilities Studies and Animal and Poultry Sciences with an emphasis in Equine Production. 

My research interests consist of combining my love for animals and the environment with my desire to further help the people in the underserved Appalachian region. Currently, I am examining the benefits of increased exposure to nature in rural Appalachian children in relation to ecological reasoning. I am also interested in the roles of executive function and inductive reasoning in the development of children‚Äôs ecological reasoning. 

At Virginia Tech, I studied the emotional benefits of pet ownership for children during the start of the Covid-19 pandemic. However, I also have training in crisis intervention and disaster management. This leads to my advocacy for victims experiencing the traumatic events of intimate partner violence, suicide, sexual assault, and substance abuse.

description:
Success is best measured by how one's actions elevate the lives of others. I have dedicated my life to public service and am incredibly grateful for the opportunities I have had to serve others and genuinely make a difference. I have always led by example and demonstrated great passion, focus, and dedication in all undertakings. I have successfully pursued justice on behalf of countless victims of crimes. After the 9/11 attacks, my career took on more complex and significant challenges as I traveled to remote areas of the world in support of international objectives. Throughout it all I have learned that good and evil exists in all cultures and cannot simply be defined by nationality, race, religion, or creed.  

I served as a the Chief of Instruction at the FBI Academy where I had the privilege of mentoring instructors, New Agents and New Intelligence Analyst Trainees. This rewarding opportunity enabled me to leverage my experience to prepare, motivate, and inspire the next generation of FBI leaders. One of the most important responsibilities I had was ensuring those I served found meaningful purpose and connection to one another as well as to the greater mission. I am an accomplished leader focused on inspiring and motivating others to realize their true potential and to believe in themselves. 

While I have received numerous formal awards and recognition, I find the greatest reward in helping others to grow and succeed. There is nothing more inspiring than to watch those I have mentored begin to recognize their own potential as they develop and flourish. By establishing cultures of genuine care, mutual accountability, and inspired success, I have consistently led resilient teams which have exceeded organizational goals and expectations. 

I have a MA in Leadership and Executive Management from Liberty University and a BA in Law and Justice from The College of New Jersey. 

I am eager to hear from former colleagues, leaders, and those who seek to inspire and motivate others.

description: A synthetic organic chemist by training, over a decade, is in the process of transformation into the field of Medicinal Chemistry, where Biology and Organic Chemistry complement each other. Here, I am researching to cure some of the deadly diseases, cancer, and aging by modulating protein-protein interactions (PPI). PPI has not been explored assiduously. In this process, we are using biophysical tools, AI, computational modeling,  organic chemistry, and medicinal chemistry (Hit to lead). Before SMDC, I interned in GSK in the Herat Failure DPU in Pennsylvania, where I was involved in the candidate selection and API synthesis ‚Äî got to familiar how a hit in the screening evolve to a new entity before it goes to the clinic. Before coming to the US, I worked as a process chemist in BASF India.

jobLocation: San Diego County, California, United States
company2: University of California San Francisco -School of Pharmacy
jobDescription2: Works as a medicinal chemist in the Small Molecule Drug Discovery Center. Here, we study complex PPI (Protein-Protein interaction), with the help of small molecules, and their implication in several diseases, like cancer, neurodegenerative diseases including Alzheimer's. We learn these interactions using several biophysical tools, like surface plasmon resonance, size exclusion chromatography, dynamic light scattering. We also explore structure-guided (PyMOL, Maestro, Chimera) SAR to get better biophysical properties from these molecules needed for the drug which is the ultimate goal of our all efforts.

description:
I am currently a final year graduate student in Chemistry pursuing my Ph.D at University of Louisville. I have a strong expertise and hands on experience in the field of organic synthesis, chemical biology, photoredox chemistry and nano formulations. Over the years, I have developed a strong passion for synthetic chemistry and I am currently utilizing this knowledge to solve critical problems in the field of bioengineering.

My current research focuses on long term stabilization of proteins and nucleic acid biomarkers at ambient temperatures using our lab's patented sol gel technology. In past, I have worked on several projects including development of new catalysts, photoredox chemistry and halogen chemistry. I have co-written and published 6 scientific articles individually and in collaboration so far and determined to publish more.

I have hands on expertise in working on several analytical instruments and techniques such as NMR, GC-MS, SDS-PAGE, Flash HPLC, ELISA, ddPCR, CD, UV-Vis spectroscopy, FTIR, Raman spectroscopy, DOE, microwave synthesis, optimization and purification.

‚Ä¢	Biophysical characterization of intramolecular guanine quadruplex that is formed by a guanine-rich sequence present in the WNV genome

Also, studied the heteroplasmic shift due to the inhibition of replication of mutated mitochondrial DNA by PNA and gamma-modified PNA.

Developed high-yielding & scalable multi-step pathways from a fermentation product, muconic acid, to bio-based chemicals terephthalic acid & caprolactone. jobDescription:
https://impact-nano.com/ in Devens, MA. 
‚óè I am employee # 3, after the two co-founders, who are industry veterans, in a local chemistry contract manufacturing organization (CMO) start-up company.
‚óè My first task was to set-up our synthetic and analytical research laboratories from scratch, starting from deciding where to put the electrical outlets in the two rooms we have. We have now a very well equipped R&D lab. 
‚óè I am now doing Green Chemistry R&D, across the Periodic Table of the Elements, in order to provide our customers, many of them in the electronics industry, with high purity fine chemicals, such as https://www.atomiclimits.com/alddatabase/ , allowing our customers to offer more sustainably manufactured products with improved performance.
‚óè Many of the synthetic targets are highly moisture and/or oxygen sensitive coordination complexes, requiring Schlenk line and glove box techniques.
‚óè Note: the "nano" in Impact Nano's name refers to us controlling the impurity levels of our products at the nano level.
‚óè For 8 months taught an experienced chemical equipment operator how to do glassware R&D lab scale experiments. In 4 internship segments (3 x the same undergraduate physics student; 1 x undergraduate chemistry student) trained them in analytical chemistry and synthetic inorganic chemistry using glove box + Schlenk line techniques.
jobDescription2:
Reason for leaving: loss of sales due to the competing technology D2T2, the trade war with China & COVID19 forced Zink to put R&D on hold.
‚óè Formulated thermochromic & functional mixtures/layers to replace individual components, to improve the waterborne coating quality (%solids, static+dynamic surface tension, viscosity=f(composition,T,shear rate)) & product performance (Dmin, Dmax, stability to environmental conditions & light, color gamut) of "Zink Paper."
‚óè Carefully analyzed coating defects to understand their root cause.
‚óè Carefully analyzed the optical effects of specific layers & the melting point of dye layers as a function of their composition to propose a Zink media with an expected improved color gamut.
‚óè Developed a Zink media activated by IR Laser light.
‚óè Identified suitable replacement materials when a component did not perform adequately or was discontinued by its manufacturer (which were often materials from the Cosmetics industry). 
‚óè By careful literature analysis reverse-engineered the synthesis of the discontinued surfactant Alkanol XC. 
‚óè Head of the MA office safety committee. 
‚óè Supervised & mentored junior coworkers. 
‚óè Provided technical expertise during internal & external business meetings with domestic & international global consumer electronics companies.
‚óè Supervised & troubleshooted the production of custom chemicals in Asia.
‚óè Supervised & instructed the chemistry work performed at 2 domestic CROs.
‚óè Simplified the pilot-plant production scale work-up procedures & purification to imaging quality of a Zink dye resulting in 30% cost savings. 
‚óè Performed hands-on synthesis & process optimization work of another Zink dye at a domestic custom manufacturer.
‚óè Invented a rhodamine dye having an optimized optical performance (lmax at the desired wavelength, minimized absorbance at other wavelengths, high turn-on by thermal printing), enhanced light stability & reduced cost of synthesis (6 instead of 9 steps of similar complexity).

Derek is a full professor at George Mason University School of Business, specializing in corporate finance. Derek has a BS in Mathematics and Economics from the University of Chicago, an MS in Financial Mathematics from Stanford University and a PhD in Finance from the USC Marshall School of Business. A Californian by birth and persuasion, and a Washingtonian by circumstance, Derek will never turn down a chance to debate whether P truly equals NP over a good bourbon, or a challenge to play squash.

description:
Isabelle Bajeux-Besnainou is the Dean of the Tepper School of Business at Carnegie Mellon University, where internationally renowned faculty define and lead the future of business education. At Tepper, students are prepared to graduate and successfully solve the world‚Äôs most complex challenges using advanced technology, data analytics, behavioral science and innovative thinking. Interdisciplinary collaboration, a hallmark of CMU, and experiential learning enable Tepper graduates to pursue boundless paths of enriched understanding, problem-solving and leadership in their chosen fields. 
Before arriving at Tepper, Bajeux helmed the Desautels Faculty of Management at McGill University in Montreal, Quebec, where she led the establishment of the Bensadoun School of Retail Management. While there, Bajeux launched several new master‚Äôs programs in retailing, finance and analytics, as well as introducing a series of interdisciplinary minors such as entrepreneurship for undergraduates, and data analytics for multiple degree programs. Bajeux was Associate Dean for Undergraduate Programs and Chair of the Finance Department at the George Washington University School of Business before she joined McGill.

An alumna of the √âcole Normale Sup√©rieure in Mathematics with a doctorate in Mathematics Applied to Finance from Universit√© Paris-Dauphine, Bajeux‚Äôs areas of expertise include asset pricing, portfolio management, and credit risk. She has been a speaker on topics such as the future of work and increasing the representation of women in finance and in Business.

Her research has been published in Management Science, Mathematical Finance, Journal of Economic Dynamics and Control, American Economic Review, and The Journal of Business.

description:
I am a Principal & Consulting Actuary at Milliman, based out of Seattle, WA. I consult to a broad range of 
 healthcare organizations that include health plans, Medicare Advantage plans, provider groups, employer groups, and the Department of Veterans Affairs.

I am passionate about making US healthcare better for all of us and future generations. Healthcare is a rich area, full of complexity and connections between government policy/regulations, population health, business practices, medical practice, and real people's lives. Recently, I've been focusing on innovators and digital health companies.

These are my areas of expertise
- Medicare Advantage bid development and support
- Risk adjustment models and other predictive analytics
- Pharmacy contracting, including formulary and rebates
- Year-end financial statements, reserving, Actuarial Opinions for healthcare companies
- Pricing models, rating, and benefit relativities
- Retrospective cost and utilization review
- ROI and cost savings evaluation
headline: Principal & Consulting Actuary at Milliman | healthcare finance & analytics
jobDescription:

description:
Inderpreet is a renewable energy enthusiast and has over 20 years experience building large scale infrastructure projects, patented application products, extremely profitable operations, and raising venture/project finance for startups and fortune 500 companies in energy, retail, financial services, telecommunications, manufacturing, CPG, and service industries. After his successful stint in Silicon Valley, he thought of starting a venture that will have a direct and positive social impact with respect to improving the livelihood in parts of rural India. Given his undergrad in electronics engineering, passion for solar power development and Indian government policy impetus around rural electrification, clean energy delivery to rural household through distributed solar power generation was the obvious choice leading to his creation of Azure Power in 2007. 
Inderpreet has relentlessly lobbied generation based incentives in solar sector through Clean Trade initiatives across US and India. His work has been highlighted in top tier publications such as Wall Street Journal, New York Times, Financial Times, Business Today, and Economic Times and he is a sought after speaker at major solar power events in India and abroad including Solar Power International, Inter Solar and other leading solar conferences. He is passionate about rural electrification and energy security through clean energy sources.
Inderpreet graduated from Haas School of Business at UC Berkeley and has Bachelors in Electronics Engineering from G.N.D.U, Punjab.

Specialties: venture finance, project finance, organization design, branding, engineering, operations, government liaison and policy framework design.

Vert One simplifies finance for founder-led small and medium enterprises engaged in climate adaptation and mitigation activities. We offer a simple mobile application for project based companies to run their business. Our customers can manage, control and track their project budgets and spend from the convenience of their smartphone 24x7, thus freeing up more time for them to focus on their business than chasing routine finance matters. Our in-built insights capability proactively alerts matters that need attention such as potential funds shortfall or auto-reminders for unpaid invoices. As you run your business, we manage your accounts and even offer credit that you need to grow.

jobDescription2:
Enterprise controller for 10 entities, overseeing Accounting, Payroll, Strategic Procurement ($375M in annual spend), external financial reporting & audit, and regulatory & statutory compliance filings. Manage 5 direct reports and a total team of 19. 

‚úî Perform as international accounting leader for a complex organization with ~70% of revenues derived outside the US.
‚úî Drove transformation by spearheading the implementation of NetSuite ERP and serving as a project lead and sponsor. ERP significantly reduced risk exposure by improving controls and spend visibility.
‚úî Secured increases in efficiency and control by implementing an end-to-end Procure to Pay process in NetSuite. 
‚úî Developed strategies to optimize accounting resources, processes, and internal controls, in alignment with vision and goals. Selected a new external auditor. Ensured GAAP compliance. Adopted ASC 606 revenue recognition standard.
‚úî Optimize payroll operations, ensuring compliance with payroll and tax regulations across multiple countries. Championed the ongoing transition to a single-vendor international payroll system/platform via CloudPay, consolidating 7 international payrolls supporting ~150 employees (of 800 total global employees).
‚úî Transformed the Accounting team through a strategic restructuring, optimizing resources while automating systems and processes.
‚úî Minimize company‚Äôs risk profile by leading and ensuring financial reporting compliance across all related entities, both domestic and foreign, to include United States, India, China, United Arab Emirates, and Singapore.
‚úî Collaborate and serve as strategic business partner/advisor to cross functional teams on accounting and finance issues. Recommend accounting and finance solutions that maximize business value, while reducing risk.

description:
Makhtar Diop is the Managing Director of the International Finance Corporation (IFC), the private sector arm of the World Bank Group. He assumed this position on March 1st, 2021. Prior to this appointment, he was the World Bank‚Äôs Vice President for Infrastructure, where he led the Bank‚Äôs global efforts to build sustainable infrastructure in developing and emerging economies. In this role, he oversaw the Bank‚Äôs critical work in energy, transport, digital infrastructure, and public-private partnerships.

Mr. Diop brings to the post a deep level of experience and understanding of development challenges and a firm grasp of the public/private sector interface. His main priorities will be to mobilize investments in the poorest and most fragile countries and create the conditions for a resilient, inclusive, and sustainable recovery. 

A recognized opinion leader in the economic and social development field, Makhtar Diop has been named one of the 100 most influential Africans in the world. In 2015, he received the prestigious Regents‚Äô Lectureship Award from the University of California, Berkeley.

description:
I am a Junior studying Political Science and History. I am seeking roles in the political field. I am fascinated by the ways in which people interact with each other, governments, larger institutions, and the environment. I am particularly interested in environmental justice, international development, and foreign policy. I have experience in climate change issues, Middle Eastern politics and culture, and foreign policy. I am also interested in social justice issues within the U.S. and abroad, particularly criminal justice, wealth inequality, and unemployment. 

I have interned for Susan Gibson, author of 'How To Be An Amazing Volunteer Overseas,' and assisted with partnership creation, outreach, event planning, and research. I am a member of Effective Altruism, a global organization focussing on how to tackle the world's most pressing problems effectively. I completed a fellowship with the organization in the fall of 2022. 

I am currently studying abroad for the spring semester at Kings College London, where I am focussing on politics and philosophy. 

I am skilled in political research and writing. I am looking to enhance my experience in the political science, environmental justice, foreign policy, and public policy fields.

description:
Research scientist and business consultant with an MBA and PhD in Business from the Booth School of Business, a PhD in Psychology, an MA in Public Policy, and an MA in Social Science from the University of Chicago. Established expertise in conducting mixed-methods research across multiple domains as well as running online influence / behavior change campaigns. An excellent communicator who can translate complex scientific and academic insights into actionable solutions. Extensive experience presenting to diverse audiences, from scientists to students to international executives.

Summary
---------------
	- 14 years of experience conducting mixed-methods research combining a wide array of theoretical frameworks, research methods, and statistical tools across a range of research domains.
	- 10 years' consulting experience leveraging cutting-edge academic research to drive innovative, actionable solutions within nonprofit and private enterprises
	- Interdisciplinary training and a high-level of expertise in multiple disciplines, including business, public policy, psychology, decision science, microeconomics, statistics, econometrics, and computer science
	- Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written skills - with demonstrated success communicating complex analytic frameworks and quantitative research methods to executive decision makers
	- Highly successful at leading courses and workshops covering a wide-range of topics, from business-focused (Business Statistics; Managerial Decision Making; Advanced Negotiations) to core undergraduate courses
	- Expert in domains with direct application to policy and business, including consumer behavior, behavioral marketing, influence campaigns, decision making, decision biases, risk perception and behavior change 
	- Deep experience in the application of a broad array of statistical methods, statistical software (SPSS / Excel), scripting languages (R / Python), as well as familiarity with database scripting (SQL)
headline: Behavioral Scientist | Political Science / Policy Analyst
jobDescription2:
‚Ä¢ 	As a graduate student, research assistant, business consultant, and doctoral researcher, I led and collaborated on diverse projects at the intersection of cognitive/social psychology, judgement & decision making, behavioral economics, behavioral marketing, consumer choice, and public policy

 	‚Ä¢ 	Extensive expertise in a wide-range of research methods, including psychometrics, survey-design, usability studies, open feedback interviews, attention-tracking, etc. ‚Äì prioritizing converging evidence from a combination of observational studies, natural experiments, lab studies, and field interventions 

 	‚Ä¢ 	Mastery over a variety of statistical analysis tools, including inferential statistics, linear regressions, mixed-effects models, panel data / time-series analysis, classification and clustering, structural equation modelling, regression tress, random forests as well as other ‚Äúbig data‚Äù approaches 

	‚Ä¢ 	Research topics include, the effect of attention on conscious perception, the allocation of importance, risk perception, and consumer choice; political partisanship; perception of corruption; perception of legitimacy; the effect of media bias; voluntary compliance with the law; and, willingness to cheat
school: The University of Chicago Booth School of Business
schoolDescription2:
Dual-track Ph.D program in Business (Center for Decision Research) and Cognitive Psychology (Department of Psychology) focused on ‚ÄúBehavioral Policy and Intervention.‚Äù This has two complementary parts: (1) apply the latest research from cognitive science / behavioral economics to analyze an issue within the business or policy space; (2) use that analysis to design ethical, efficient, and cost-effective ‚Äúinterventions‚Äù to influence behavior and change outcomes. In short: identify the central behavior; and design solutions to change that behavior. 

I also focused on methodology, including: novel online research methods; replicable research pipelines; use of statistical models, including mixed-effects models, panel-data, machine learning. 

Areas of expertise: 
decision making, attention, risk perception, decision biases, consumer perception, perceived corruption / legitimacy, and compliance with laws/ regulations, predictive modelling, statistical analysis

description:
Born to French and Japanese parents, I've been blessed to live in the beautiful cities of Tokyo, Sydney, London and Boston throughout my life. I owe a great amount to my parents for an environment that was both flexible enough for me to follow my different dreams and firm enough to help me identify and stay true to my values. I'm grateful to them for speaking to me in their own native languages from birth, and I've continued that love for cultures by pursuing Chinese for the last seven years.

It doesn't make sense for any one culture to have identified the best way to live life. And so I'm fascinated about differences and will take any chance to have my assumptions tested. I do that through hosting a podcast, readings books from different cultures, and having conversations with as many people as possible.

At MIT and in my life, this translates into work in negotiation and conflict resolution (e.g., helping to teach the undergraduate negotiation class, doing research with HKS on negotiations in moments of crisis), public policy (e.g., supporting the Australian government to apply machine learning to education datasets), healthcare (e.g., developing a computer vision algorithm to detect diabetes from iris images), and entrepreneurship (e.g., starting MIT's first entrepreneurship club; supporting the governor of KY to promote entrepreneurship).

description:
I am a Political Science and Public Policy Major at The George Washington University. During my junior year of high school, I participated in the We the People: The Citizen and the Constitution Program held by the Center for Civic Education. My school placed 10th in the nation. We the People helped me gain the necessary experience in crafting and presenting detailed arguments on complex pieces of legislation. It was in this program that I realized my passion for public policy and all of its nuances. Through my research, I advanced my critical analysis skills, which I continue to build upon in my undergraduate classes.
Outside of the educational sphere, I have honed my communication skills through my jobs in the foodservice industry and extra-curricular leadership roles. I have bonded with a diverse group of customers quickly, leading to meaningful conversations in the short time I get to interact with them. When difficult situations have arisen, I have learned how to quickly find and mitigate the point of contention to make the conversation more seamless. I ensure all parties feel understood when collaborating with a small group or team in my leadership positions. I believe the ability to apply the combination of my enthusiasm for policy and my ability to connect with large groups of people will better my career.

description:
My name is Lizzie Hahn, and I am a dedicated and motivated undergraduate student who aspires to make a difference in the world. I am currently pursuing a degree in Political Science with a focus on Public Policy and a minor in International Business at George Washington University. I am currently on the pre-law track, and I am hoping to attend law school after my time as an undergraduate. My time as a Research Assistant at the university has honed my abilities in both communication and education while also providing me with valuable real-world experience in various fields that intersect with the law.

My diverse background, ranging from my role as a scheduling and financing intern to my position as an education fellow studying the effects of consumer finance, has equipped me with a unique set of experiences and skills that I am eager to bring to any opportunity.

In addition to my academic and professional pursuits, I am actively engaged in a number of organizations that align with my values and interests. I serve as co-director of education and advocacy for my university's chapter of Democracy Matters, and I am an integral member of the Professional and Academic Affairs Committee of Phi Alpha Delta Pre-Law society. I am also thrilled to have recently joined the GW Hatchet as a Culture Reporter, where I hope to bring fresh perspectives and engage in thought-provoking discussions.

I am eager to connect with like-minded individuals who share my passion for political science, public policy, and business and explore opportunities to grow and make a meaningful impact. Let's connect and collaborate toward a better future!

description:
In the pursuit of my knowledge and delight to learn new things, I have always adopted a stern approach to attain a deep understanding of the subject at hand; this has amply reflected in my consistently well performing career. 

 I currently work as a  Business Information Analyst II at Anthem, Inc. As a part of my current job role I have gained immense knowledge on the Health Care systems. I even got a chance to even work alongside major companies such as Blue Cross Blue Shield of Minnesota and Prime Therapeutics. 

Prior to my current job, I worked as a Database Administrator/Business Analyst Co-Op at North Memorial Health Care, Minneapolis. Though being offered an internship for just 5 months in the start, moving forward looking at my capabilities and learning abilities my internship was extended. During my stay in the USA, I have also worked as a Tech Student at the university.

 Coming from a background where I have been taught to value the significance of education, I am proud to have reached this stage in my life. I graduated as a full time Graduate student in the Information Technology program with a Business Analysis certification at the University of St. Thomas, Minnesota in the month of May, 2018. I also did my under graduation in Information Technology from Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University-Hyderabad. I was awarded the "Best Academic Performer" award in my first year of under-graduate study. Alongside, I also received the prestigious IEEE Computer Society Richard E. Merwin Student scholarship in the year 2016 for my extraordinary academic skills and professional efforts.

 Four to five years from now, I picture myself among a group of like-minded researchers in the field of Information Technology giving my utmost suggestions and ideas. I am confident that my professional experiences, sharp aptitude and strong incentives will assist me in successfully accomplishing the goals I have set for myself.

description: I‚Äôm a quant turned financial economist at the Office of Financial Research, where I monitor and conduct research on U.S. financial stability. My recent research focuses on the financial stability implications of hedge fund activities. I have also done work in agent-based modeling and quantitative risk management. I am an expert on regulatory data filed by investment advisers managing private funds, such as hedge funds and private equity funds. I specialize in the data wrangling of financial data sets and developing full-stack advanced analytics and visualization solutions. I developed the OFR Financial Stress Index. I am also an adjunct professor at Georgetown University, where I teach courses on the mathematics of derivatives pricing and programming in python, R, and SAS for data science, stochastic simulation, and scientific computing. I have a Ph.D. in mathematics from the University of Texas at Austin. I‚Äôm also a CFA charterholder and a certified FRM.

description:
I am a Data Scientist with a background in Mathematics. I have experience working on projects involving Data Acquisition, Statistical Analysis, Machine Learning, Sentiment Analysis via NLP, and Image Classification via Deep Learning

After graduating from Virginia Tech with a Bachelor of Science in Mathematics, I spent a couple of years living in Melbourne, Australia, working as a Software Developer for Cru, a non-profit organization. Coming back to the US, I spent a few years looking after some sick family members before working at Sam‚Äôs Club as a Department Manager.

Knowing that I wanted to use my math prowess to land a job, I decided to head back to school to refine and update my skills. I chose to pursue a Data Science career because it combines my aptitude for numbers, coding, and helping people. I recently graduated from Flatiron School with newly acquired experience in Python, SQL, Machine Learning, and more. If hired, I‚Äôll bring leadership, integrity, value, and a passion for all things data, with the goal of helping companies drive toward positive results
headline: Data Scientist | Mathematician | World-Traveller
jobDescription2:
Project: Identifying Melanoma in Images using Deep Learning
Classified images of skin lesions as either benign or malignant with the goal of having my model be deployed on an app in order to speed up the public‚Äôs response time to visit a Dermatologist
- Collected over 38k images from the International Skin Imaging Collaboration obtained through a Kaggle Competition
- Utilized Keras library to generate the image data, fit the model, and evaluate the results
- Evaluated 6 models with the final one being a VGG16 pre-trained CNN with an accuracy of 94% and a recall score of 84%
- Ran on Kaggle‚Äôs servers and my code is public

Project: Tweet Sentiment Analysis
Supervised classification algorithm to identify positive sentiment from tweets in order to help an investment company gauge which tech companies to investigate further for possible investment
- Collaborated with 2 team members to develop a strong notebook, organized GitHub repository & captivative presentation with data insights
- Conducted natural language processing (NLP) with NLTK to tokenize and vectorize 9k tweets from CrowdFlower via data.world that were collected at 2013 SXSW
- Employed Na√Øve Bayes Classifier, Logistic Regression with PCA, and a tuned Neural Network to model probability of a tweet having a positive sentiment
 
Project: Tanzania Water Wells
A predictive model to classify the functionality of wells in Tanzania, as a part of an open competition on DrivenData.org
- Led 2 team members and oversaw the distribution of tasks and deadlines
- Applied Scikit-learn to split the 59k into a training, validation, and testing set, while using Pipeline to preprocess the data
- Modeled with a Decision Tree Classifier, Logistic Regression, Random Forest Classifier (RFC), K-Nearest Neighbors and tuned the hyperparameters with a Grid Search
- Achieved an 81% accuracy on the test set for our final model, a tuned RFC, without overfitting to the training set

As a senior technical manager, I excel at leading large interdisciplinary teams in united research efforts to include capability and software development activities as well as effectively communicating technical results and challenges to stakeholders at all levels of corporate and government leadership. I have published several original works in mathematics and cryptography, and been awarded multiple patents these areas.

description:
When I was in 3rd grade, I learned about recycling in class and was so excited to tell my mom about how we could help the Earth by doing it at home.  This was the first moment whenI truly realized just how important the environment is to me.  Throughout my entire education, from grade school to undergrad, I have been passionate about what I and others can do to save our world from climate change. This drive has translated into my interests in humanitarianism, ecological critical theory, and helping marginalized groups.

While in undergraduate school at Marymount University, I studied both English (Writing) and Philosophy.  The areas of study that I am most interested in are applied ethics, law, writing, editing, graphic design, data analysis, and sustainability/environmental advocacy.  My plan after graduating is to find a great, supportive place to work before I then transition to law school.  Office feel and company missions are very important to me when evaluating new jobs/opportunities.  I hope to graduate law school in or around 2027, with specific concentrations in legal writing and environmental law.  

Interests:
- Humanitarian Ethics & Law
- Environmental Law
- Environmental Action
- Civil & Social Movements
- Applied Ethics
- Critical Theory

description:
Have you thought about what reality is like? Like, do colors exist or not? I‚Äôm a PhD student in Philosophy at the University of Maryland, College Park, and this is what I get paid to do on a fairly regular basis. While asking these abstract questions is fun, what I find most rewarding about the program is the opportunity to hear what the next generation of college students thinks in the courses that I teach. Surprisingly, my last batch of students was fairly willing to go along with the idea that we don't have free will.

When I'm not thinking about reality and how weird it is, I'm probably learning about data. Data is increasingly playing a larger and larger role in the way that companies operate, and it is probably the realest manifestation of the platitude "knowledge is power." I'm interested in seeing how a philosophical background might bring a fresh perspective to the field of data analytics. In the introductions of many online data science courses, students are told that data science and data analysis are about storytelling. In the world of philosophy, it's about asking the right questions. When the two are combined, the thought is that the right questions will be answered in the best way possible - this is the result that I'm after.

If you're interested in talking about how to harness the most job-desperate market for the sake of analyzing data and pursuing the right questions, feel free to shoot me an email at mr.benfan@gmail.com!

Technical Skills:

‚Ä¢ LaTeX/Overleaf
‚Ä¢ Microsoft Excel

description:
I feel privileged in my education to have been introduced to the great tradition of philosophy that is rooted in the ancient Greeks. 

In the classroom I seek to initiate students into doing philosophy through inviting them into a conversation with great philosophers. Outside the classroom I lecture and write on various philosophical topics in both scholarly and popular venues, and I bring much of my work to a wider audience at my website LIFE-CRAFT.ORG, where I strive to apply an ancient wisdom to life today. Resources there include free mini-courses Man of the Household and Woman of the Household.

headline: Doctoral Candidate (ABD) in Philosophy, Georgetown University
jobDescription: I am a full-time doctoral candidate in Philosophy (ABD) at Georgetown University and expect to complete my degree by the spring of 2024. My dissertation puts forward a palliative approach drawn from philosophical reflection on Greek tragedy as an urgent and necessary complement to existing therapeutic treatments for post-traumatic stress and moral injury.
jobDescription2: I designed and taught several undergraduate introductory philosophy courses for diverse audiences. My ‚ÄúHappiness and Its Discontents‚Äù course critically engaged different conceptions of human flourishing from the history of philosophy and explored the problem of the disharmony between virtuous action and happiness, which many ancient and modern philosophers have felt a pressing need to resolve, and which I find to be very meaningful for students who face the contemporary and seemingly intractable crises of gun violence, climate change, systemic injustice, violations of human dignity, political extremism, etc. I concentrated heavily on students‚Äô development of critical reading, thinking, and writing skills. I gained experience designing diverse curriculums that address issues of human dignity, social justice, and holistic well-being across the intellectual, social, and spiritual dimensions of life. I personally helped several undergraduate students apply for and receive scholarships or admission to highly selective academic programs, including a recipient of Georgetown‚Äôs prestigious Patrick Healy Diversity Fellowship.

description:
Dr. Ayittey, a native of Ghana, was a Distinguished Economist at American University and now President of the Free Africa Foundation, both in Washington. He obtained his Ph.D. from the University of Manitoba, Winnipeg, Canada in. He has published six books on Africa: Indigenous African Institutions; Africa Betrayed; The Blueprint For Ghana's Economic Recovery, Africa In Chaos and Africa Unchained: The Blueprint for Africa‚Äôs Future. 

Africa Betrayed won the 1993 H.L. Mencken Award for "Best Book for 1992." (The award is named after the American journalist who championed personal freedom). In 2009, he was selected by the Foreign Policy magazine among the World‚Äôs Top 100 Global Thinkers. His new book, Defeating Dictators, was published in November 2011.

He has testified before US Congressional committees and the Senate of Canada. He has served as a consultant to several organizations, including the World Bank, US AID, and International Council on Metals and the Environment (ICME). He has given lectures to various organizations, institutions and universities, including the National Bar Association, the International Monetary Fund (IMF), the US State Department, US Foreign Service, and the United Nations Development Program (UNDP). He has appeared on several radio and television programs, including Canada AM, CBS "Nightwatch," ABC "Nightline," MacNeil/Lehrer NewsHour, C-SPAN, BBC World Service, and CNN International. He appears regularly on Straight Talk Africa ‚Äì a Voice of America station. He has been invited to the White House on three occasions by three Presidents.

In short, he is widely regarded as the authority on Africa.
headline: Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) at University of Manitoba
location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
jobDescription:
Africa's record on political and human rights has been worse than appalling. Torture, wanton executions and pillage are daily orchestrated by regimes with palpable contempt for human life and decency. Tyranny and flagrant denial of basic civil liberties are rampant on a continent that has more dictators per capita than any other region in the world.
Is there any hope for Africa in the new millennium?
THE FREE AFRICA FOUNDATION (FAF) believes there is hope for Africa and progress can be made. FAF is a non-profit, non-ideological, non-political and non-denominational organization dedicated to reversing Africa's economic decline. The Foundation is a coterie of serious-minded African reformers and thinkers, drawn from Africa and Africans in the diaspora, whose preoccupation is crafting new, African-based and non-governmental strategies and solutions to tackle Africa=s crises. These new ideas are then channeled to progressive indigenous NGOs in Africa that are affiliated with FAF. They are provided with assistance and support to carry out these reform initiatives and programs.

description:
As a future accounting major and philosophy minor, there are many dynamic skills that I have. Some of these skills are more applicable to one of my intended areas of study than others. Some can be applied to both. 

Analysis has always been a skill of mine. My ability to look at and analyze things in a logical way has regularly been an asset in interpreting the issues at hand and subsequently making conclusions or decisions based on this. Being personable and open-minded has also helped me establish healthy relationships with those around me, facilitating collaboration and ensuring the creation of a positive environment. Though I am more business-oriented, I find that philosophy encourages me to think more abstractly and cultivates creativity. Philosophy both allows me to use my analytical skills for a different purpose and enables me to continue improving my writing. 

Because my skills are easily adaptable to a variety of industries, I am more than willing to explore any opportunity though I ultimately do see myself in the accounting industry. That being said, my desire to continue learning something new every day motivates me to keep my options open and take on any opportunity that helps me improve as an individual.

description: The Department of Philosophy at the George Washington University is a pluralist department with ten full-time faculty and ten part-time faculty offering courses in the history of philosophy, ethics, social, political, and legal philosophy, logic, philosophy of mind, philosophy of science, analytic, American, continental philosophy, and philosophy of race and gender. jobDescription:
Here in the Department of Philosophy at the George Washington University, our philosophy majors in both tracks have enjoyed a wide range of post-graduate careers both in and outside the academy and find that the analytical skills they develop as philosophy majors help them to be successful in many different professions including law, medicine, teaching, business, and public policy. We offer two different majors in our department: 

A traditional track that provides a strong background in the history of philosophy (especially recommended for students who intend to pursue a graduate degree in Philosophy).
A philosophy and public affairs option that emphasizes value theory and social and political philosophy.

Our department is distinctive in offering an MA in Philosophy and Social Policy, an interdisciplinary graduate program that takes full advantage of our downtown Washington, D.C., location. In addition to their philosophy and policy graduate courses, our MA students choose among a wide variety of offerings in the Trachtenberg School of Public Policy and Public Administration and interact closely with graduate students from all over the University. Many of our MA students obtain policy internships in Washington while they are enrolled in the program, creating an exciting synergy between their coursework and their employment experience. These internships have frequently led to full-time positions in prominent policy organizations upon graduation.

description:
Muzaffar is a seasoned wireless technologist with over 25 years of hands on experience with telecom / wireless business case definition, technology assessment and deep engineering product development and test management. He has worked directly for a Tier 1 US wireless carrier, Tier 1 Global Device Manufacturers and leading MSOs. 

He has advised several clients in the wireless ecosystem and the convergence of telecom industry leveraging his experience of working through the entire product development life cycle from technical requirements definition, design and thru to deployment of wireless products and services. 

Muzaffar has published several research papers in leading industry conferences and has chaired technical sessions. He was also an invited key note speaker in an international conference on Internet of Things (IoT), Embedded Systems and Communications.

Muzaffar holds a Masters in EE and a PhD in Systems Engineering, both from Boston University.

description:
I am a scholar of philosophy, religious studies and history of science, working on multiple traditions and cultures. Among all my academic interests, how to revive, reform and introduce the traditional Chinese thought in a comparative and contemporary context stands front and center. For my career goals, I primarily love to write; also, to teach, and then, to have conversations with all kinds of ordinary people for enriching my life experience and getting to know the world better; and finally, to act in order to bring more harmonies into the world .
For courses, I can teach western philosophy (virtually all important philosophers, but my primary expertise is early modern philosophy from Descartes to Kant), Chinese philosophy, western religion (mainly about the three Abrahamic religions with Christianity as its focus), Eastern Religion, Chinese religion, philosophy of science, philosophy of religion, ethics, religion and science, Chinese history, Chinese poetry, comparative religion, comparative theology, and Christian theology.
My professional activities and updated resume can be found at my personal website: http://binsong.live/

description:
Financial Analysis ‚Äì Accounting Expertise ‚Äì Process Improvement 
‚ÄúMerging people, technology, and processes to move business forward‚Äù

If I were to describe myself in a just a few words, I would say that I am an ambitious, progressive, initiative-taking, and experienced financial professional, offering 15+ years of excellent communication, critical thinking skills and analytical acumen, with added strengths in project management, process improvement, reporting/analyses, budgeting, and team leadership. I continue to be positively challenged through efforts to identify, develop, track and report on business processes, key performance indicators, cost-control initiatives, process improvement plans, and  staff development programs. I am fortunate to have worked with some of the best organizations, and with the best people. Throughout my career, I always looked for the opportunity to take on additional responsibilities of higher expectation and challenge, managing multimillion-dollar projects by balancing sound business judgment, a strong sense of urgency, excellent financial/accounting analyses, and a quality-driven focus. These are the qualities that have enabled me to exceed goals and get the impossible accomplished. 

I like to tackle problems head-on, work smart, and resolve issues with a ‚Äúdo it right, the first time and all the time‚Äù credo, while seeking out better ways to look at problems and determine solutions. I am a firm believer in continued education and training, and in fact I received my dual Master of Business Administration/Master of Accountancy in 2021, and a Bachelor of Art in Studio Art in 2003. In addition, I am studying for my CPA certification, which I anticipate I will complete in 2022. I am well regarded for my ability to work collaboratively across disparate endpoints to ensure an efficiency-centric and quality-driven culture that exceeds organizational objectives. Lastly, I feel strongly that professional presence, lead-by-example work style, tact, and bilateral communication are lost arts ‚Äì but shouldn‚Äôt be. 
My key skills include: 
Cost Accounting Expertise ‚Ä¢ Process Improvement ‚Ä¢ MBA/MAcc ‚Ä¢ CPA (in Progress) ‚Ä¢ Budgeting & Forecasting  Operational Efficiencies ‚Ä¢ Team Leadership & Development ‚Ä¢ SAP ‚Ä¢ Oracle ‚Ä¢ Reporting   ‚Ä¢ Reconciliation ‚Ä¢ GAAP ‚Ä¢
General Ledger ‚Ä¢ Risk Mitigation ‚Ä¢ Accounts Receivable/Payable ‚Ä¢ Inventory Accounting ‚Ä¢ QuickBooks
Project Management ‚Ä¢ Franchise Operations ‚Ä¢ Benefits/Payroll Administration ‚Ä¢ Vendor/Client Relationships
headline: Corporate Accountant
jobDescription2: As VP of Finance, I implement process and system changes to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the general ledger, development of financial results and internal and external reports with a  continuous improvement mindset. I am especially well-versed in utilizing QuickBooks, A/P, and A/R to prepare monthly journal transactions including intercompany for 15 entities, balance sheet reconciliations, financial and ad hoc reporting, and presentation to partners, and I have significantly improved accounting operations including across all these areas in addition to billing, GL, cost accounting, inventory accounting and revenue recognition, and report variances. I prepare and publish timely monthly financial statements that provide the company with integral data that ensures sound decision making. I also play a key role in the identification of areas of opportunity and challenge with regard to HR operations, where I develop, implement, maintain, and track timely and critical benefits administration procedures, payroll policies and procedures, and maintain bimonthly payroll for multiple franchise locations. This role also has a strong project management component, including collaborating with clients and vendors to construct and open 36 franchise locations including The Joint, Amazing Lash Studio and Diesel Barbershops throughout the United States. As project manager, I also serve as key contact with sourcing vendors, clients, and the corporate team with regard to strategy development, coaching, file storage, payroll administration, and support through the launch and build of new locations/franchises, resulting in continued successful operations.
school: Mercer University - Stetson School of Business and Economics
schoolDescription: The Combined Master of Business Administration/Master of Accountancy program's combined curriculum plan requires 81 credit hours in both MBA and MAcc coursework. With both MBA and MAcc courses built into the curriculum, students gain preparation for the management of human, material and financial resources, as well as preparation for opportunities in public or private accounting. Individuals who successfully complete a Mercer Combined MBA/MAcc degree program can go on to work as business professionals in positions including: Certified Public Accountant (CPA), treasury manager, tax accountant, cost accounting manager, auditor, or financial manager.

description:
Driven by high-accountability opportunities, I enjoy collaborating with and leading multidisciplinary teams in fast-paced environments. I am experienced in Project Management, Manufacturing and R & D. I am skilled in Process Safety, Occupational Safety Management, Data Analysis, Technical Writing, Process Design and Optimization, and Customer Service. I love engaging in opportunities to learn from others. 

After three years traveling the world as an aerialist in the circus (really!), I went back to school...twice. Right out of the Big Top I attended the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign where I received my B.S. in Animal Science and Biotechnology. It turned out that vet school was not my calling. After a few years as a research technician, I went back to school to complete my B.S. in Chemical Engineering from the University of Tennessee Knoxville and haven't looked back! In my spare time I love hiking and camping, running "fun run" themed races, eating/drinking/shopping local, hosting dinner parties with boardgames, going to the dog park and dog beach with my dobie, and of course, spending time with my amazing kiddo.

description:
As a top-performing and innovative professional, I have over 17 years of experience streamlining sales operations that drive revenue, market share, and profitability. I am known for my innovative mindset, ability to take a fresh approach, and extremely self-motivated, which has resulted in devising robust go-to-market strategies that increase sales growth, as well as successfully penetrating new markets to expand business to the next level.

Given my aptitude for identifying and capturing new business opportunities, I have been able to build a network of clients and industry contacts to achieve substantial capital gains. I hold a proven record of negotiation, closing business deals, and leading exceptional efforts for cost-reduction endeavors, individually executing responsibilities equal to eight sales reps across three states.

As a dedicated mentor and compassionate leader, I strive to provide value as a company resource having directed a team of 30+ high-performing manufacturers sales representatives that executed operations pertaining to shortlisting and streamlining target markets and consistently surpassed defined objectives. 

A few of my career highlights include:

-Contributed towards the company's advancement into new markets by conducting market research, devising go-to-market strategies, and developing a plan to increase revenue.
-Successfully penetrated new markets, expanded the business to the next level, and consistently outperformed by exceeding set targets by upwards of 125% while serving as Division Vice President of Sales.
-Improved sales growth by 42%, in the first year, through outstanding analytical skills while I served as Regional Sales Manager.

"Practice is just as valuable as a sale. The sale with make you a living; the skill will make you a fortune."--Jim Rohn

jobDescription2:
Lyons Industries produces bathtubs, shower bases, and walls sold in home improvement stores. My main responsibilities were to develop proprietary business software and IT system administration.

‚Ä¢	Turn concepts into software, find solutions to contradictions, and just make things work. Everybody understands the obstacles they overcome every day at work. Speaking to everyone involved from the owner to the employees on the shop floor, I would form a clear model of the problems, goals, root causes, and constraints. My task was to solve the problems software could solve within the scope and budget defined.

‚Ä¢	Develop and deploy various scheduled task scripts and C# programs for automating business administrative workloads.

‚Ä¢	Develop custom software and analytical tools to manage production scheduling, shipping scheduling, raw material consumption, inventory tracking, labor projections, manufacturing costs, shipment sales values, scrap, and real time data collection. This is a basic MRP system integrated with production operations to give real time KPI analytics, alerts, and immediate "What if" analysis for agile responses to disruption and immediate communication. They wanted a proprietary system, optimized to fit an extreme version of Just In Time manufacturing, with maximum flexibility in planning and operations, so the intersection of customer satisfaction and profit may be met constantly.

‚Ä¢	Develop hardware integrations to automate processes.

‚Ä¢	Administer, deploy, and develop databases and ETL workflows across multiple SQL instances and Access DB files using SSIS.

‚Ä¢	Reimplement and redesign legacy apps, converting from VBA in Access and Excel to C#, SQL, and DevExpress.

‚Ä¢	Integrate data between Infor Syteline ERP system and custom software noted above. Scheduling and Operations were not implemented in the ERP system.

‚Ä¢	Perform IT system administrator functions to manage servers and workstations throughout the company.

Andrew Streets is the Managing Partner for National Recruiting Network, a North Carolina based recruiting firm. National Recruiting Network specializes in the U.S. Plastics & Packaging Manufacturing industries. With over a decade of recruiting, sales and marketing experience, paired with a passion for competition, Andrew goes above and beyond to provide the highest quality of service to both the companies he serves and the technical professionals he guides through the career transition process. Andrew bridges the employer/employee gap by identifying areas of need within the companies he serves and presenting the highest quality and committed professionals for each area of need. Andrew‚Äôs services are always confidential and held to the highest standard of professionalism.

While pursuing his studies at College of the Albemarle, Andrew has been elected Co-President of the Phi Theta Kappa Honor Society Nu Nu Chapter, selected as an Honor Marshall of the Freshman class (top 5% GPA), and elected to represent the Elizabeth City campus as one of three Student Ambassadors chosen from a student body of over 3,000. As an Ambassador, Andrew worked closely with the President of the College, as well as the Board of Directors, representing the needs and desires of the student body firsthand and bringing about proactive change to the campus and student life. He also served as one of six college students selected by the Mayor of Elizabeth City from the 3 surrounding colleges and Universities to serve on a Collegiate Panel Board, collaborating weekly with fellow student and civil leaders to champion local change and progression.

description:
Hi ! Scott here. #GoldenDoodleDad #Swimmer #Outdoorsman #Cellist #PoetryFan

Diligent and dedicated, excited and eager, intuitive and inquisitive, precise and proud; these are a few alliterations that describe me to a T.

I am a Metrologist that works with high accuracy, high precision measurement systems that include standard table CMM's (Renishaw/Mitutoyo), Articulated Arms (FARO), Laser Trackers (FARO, LEICA), Photogrammetry, Projector, and structured light scanning. In addition to my wide range of experience with metrology equipment, I am adept with the interfacing software associated with these powerful inspection tools; most notably, I have experience with Polyworks, Spatial Analyzer, Verisurf, PC-DMIS, and CAM2.

My passion for metrology is derivative from my love for mathematics which I studied intensively at Kent State University. 

I began my career in the automotive OEM industry at RB&W MFG, working with a team of experienced design, applications, and quality engineers who pushed me, not to learn fast, but to learn smart. It was in this emergent stage of my career that I developed critical quality professional skills like GD&T, hand tool inspections, tooling, material testing, CMM operation and programming, and APQP fundamentals. 

Continuing this development of quality engineering skills, I went on to AT&F Co., where I was challenged to grow fast.  Here I learned the ins and outs of Portable CMM technology. At AT&F, I utilized PCMM technology to direct the fabrication, machining, and assembly of large components for the ship building of aircraft carriers and nuclear submarines.

Please reach out to me if you have any questions about my history and skills, I love expanding my network and am always interested in new challenges to conquer.

jobDescription:
I joined Cognizant as part of a group of individuals hired to rethink and transform the relationships and engagement models at our most important and strategic customers. While Cognizant has had an incredibly successful history helping these Fortune 100 companies grow and thrive in their respective industries, the world and technology has changed. Our relationships with these clients have not evolved as quickly as they need to despite the clients desiring more and Cognizant being able to provide more.

I personally lead the global relationship with one of Cognizant's largest and most critical Fortune 20 customers, with full global responsibility for a $150M+ P&L and 1,500+ associates providing services across the US, Europe, and India. As part of this role, we deliver high quality, high value services across both the Retail & Healthcare industries in multiple geographies to help this critical client innovate and remain competitive as they lead their respective industry segment. Key services we provide include Digital Strategy and Architecture, Application Development, Support, Quality Engineering & Assurance, Infrastructure, and Data & Analytics.

Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 193 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.
jobTitle2: Owner | Business Strategy and Technology Advisor
jobDescription2:
At Cardinal Compass Group, we partner with executives and leadership teams to assess the current state of their business and technology operations, and bring focus to their most critical strategic needs. Our ability to quickly understand and dissect even the largest and most complex organizations enables us to come into an organization and make a lasting and meaningful impact. Whether it's simply helping to get a project or initiative back on track or designing, creating, and executing a full-blown business transformation, we can help. 

Previous engagements included working with the IT CTO leadership at a world-class Fortune 100 financial services company to help reset and redesign their Public Cloud, Technology Product Management, and pricing strategies. This was accomplished by understanding the current state of the organizational efforts, building a long-term vision and strategy, and then breaking that strategy into meaningful, executable components that drive engagement and unlock overall business value. 

If there is a tough problem that you're looking for help to solve, we'd love to hear from you and discuss the opportunity to help guide your business in the right direction.

description:
I am a dependable, self-motivated individual that strives for continuous improvement.  With an accumulation of 20+ years experience working in manufacturing environments, pertaining to the automotive, food, warehousing and distilling industries. In addition I have accumulated over 8 years experience training, leading, and managing personnel and projects. I have numerous certifications which include NFPA 70E Arc Flash electrical safety. Emergency Responder Technician 29 CFR 1910.120  (HAZMAT). Emergency first reponder training. A 540 hour certification in voctional welding and blueprint reading. In addition I completed an undergraduates degree in applied science at Sullivan University's college of Technology and Design.

headline: Maintenance Supervisor at Reynolds Consumer Products
jobDescription:
‚óè	Coordinate maintenance activities relating to facility operations and production including repairs, installation of equipment, project management, and Preventative maintenance. 
‚óè	Directly manage a team of 15 maintenance personnel consisting of Union electricians, pipefitters, machinists and oilers.
‚óè	Indirectly supervise a combined maintenance workforce consisting of 91 machinist, 39 electricians, 23 pipefitters, and 15 oilers working across five defined shifts in a union environment.
‚óè	Ensure compliance of direct reports pertaining to company health and safety policies including employee counseling, time and attendance, work performance, etc.
‚óè	Provide 24/7 maintenance Support for production.
‚óè	Generate work orders.
‚óè	Utilize GDP (Good Documentation Practices) to provide daily report to engineering department and facility managers through the utilization of a web based productivity tracker.
jobDescription2:
‚óè	Provide engineering technical support to tooling, production, and maintenance personnel for facility, equipment and production.
‚óè	Project development, management, testing and implementation. 
‚óè	Perform time studies to create, document, verify and update standard work instructions.
‚óè	Utilize engineering tools such as Lean Manufacturing, Five S, Fishbone, Kaizan and Ford 8-D to achieve OEE (operational equipment excellence) targets.
‚óè	Work with tooling engineers and product design engineers to implement engineering changes throughout the lifecycle of engineering projects. Research, Development, Testing, Documentation, PPAP, Production.  
‚óè	Troubleshooting and preventative maintenance of Fanuc material handler robots. (Limited programming).
‚óè	Troubleshooting and preventative maintenance of DRS water jet robotic cut systems. (Limited programming).
‚óè	Engineering technical support for operation, calibration and maintenance of hydraulic actuated water jet intensifiers (50,000 PSI).
‚óè	Implemented Five S, procedures in an assigned area of operation and created a sustainable audit schedule.
‚óè	Improve operation efficiency through downtime reduction.
‚óè	2D AutoCAD
‚óè	Generated 6% OEE improvement for steam molding line utilizing Five S and lean manufacturing practices. 
‚óè	Track (operational equipment excellence) OEE 
‚óè	 Assist in Facility-wide implementation of waste material recycling projects that recycled scrap material into a usable fiber material that offset operational material costs. Current process utilizes a 50% reclaim usage for each new part produced.
‚óè	Provide weekly OEE reports to plant managers via an Excel based Productivity Tracker. 
‚óè	Identify and document critical parts list for production equipment
‚óè	Create work orders, RFX (request for quote) and shopping carts (purchase orders) using SAP.
‚óè	Microsoft office suite, Onedrive, Outlook, Excel, Word, Teams, Publisher, Power Point.
‚óè	Generate Project management timelines.

description:
I have over 10 years of experience in the Manufacturing Industry arena. To say that this industry is a passion is an understatement, as it is a love that has continuously helped me overcome obstacles, embrace challenges, and keep my career moving forward. description:
What my resume did not explain is my experience as a controller for two companies. My work in auditing interested me in the importance of closing security breaches.  I realized that working with international clients and vendors can be a threat vector.  This newfound realization grew my passion and interest to learn Cyber Security. Currently, I am working as an IT Asset Manager with Global Reach LLC, where I work with IT professionals to minimize the cyber threat within the organization.

To supplement my experience and educational background, I gained higher education in the cybersecurity program at American University.  The program provided foundational knowledge in Microsoft Security, Computer Networking, Cloud Security, Linux Security, Network Security, Cyber Technologies, Python,  Ethical Hacking, DFIR,  and Game Theory. I must admit it was no random win, as I always had a strong desire to pursue a career in Cyber Security.

My commitment to learning motivates me, as I am working towards my CompTIA Security+, CompTIA Network+, and IT Auditing Certifications.  My drive reflects my inherent passion for cybersecurity and propensity to grow among like-minded people.

description:
As a self-aware and driven young woman, I have been able to make professional strides preliminarily in my career. Most notably, I am currently undergoing the CPA licensure process. Reading a FAR textbook has become one of my most frequent pastimes! 

I spent the first two years of my career specializing in income taxation in the public sector. Innately, I was further malleated into a flexible and reliable professional with a high drive for efficient and precise output. Extreme attention to detail encapsulated with organization and logical thinking powers my performance. Furthermore, I exemplify an innate duty to perform, while harmonizing the utilitarian balance between client and company interests.

I then continued my career into the private sector, transitioning to accounting for commercial infrastructure portfolios on a global basis with key empahsis in renewable energy develpoment. In respect to the climate issues facing our planet, I feel honored to contribute to this initiative revitalizing worldy infrastructure within sustainability's constraints. 

On a personal note, I have a hankering for writing macros in Excel, photography, hiking with my cat, and nerdily explaining the importance of personal accounting to any ear that will listen. 

Let's connect!
